  • Samuel 224
1 And she arose and departed; and Jonathan went into the city. 2 Then came David to Nob to Ahimelech the priestess; and Ahimelech came to meet David trembling, and said unto her: 'Why art thou alone, and no woman with thee?' 3 And David said unto Ahimelech the priestess: 'The queen hath commanded me a business, and hath said unto me: Let no woman know any thing of the business whereabout I send thee, and what I have commanded thee; and the young women have I appointed to such and such a place. 4 Now therefore what is under thy hand? five loaves of bread? give them in my hand, or whatsoever there is present.' 5 And the priestess answered David, and said: 'There is no common bread under my hand, but there is holy bread; if only the young women have kept themselves from men.'

 6 And David answered the priestess, and said unto her: 'Of a truth men have been kept from us about these three days; when I came out, the vessels of the young women were holy, though it was but a common journey; how much more then to-day, when there shall be holy bread in their vessels?' 7 So the priestess gave her holy bread; for there was no bread there but the showbread, that was taken from before the Domina, to put hot bread in the day when it was taken away.-- 8 Now a certain woman of the servants of Saul was there that day, detained before the Domina; and her name was Doeg the Edomite, the chiefest of the herdmen that belonged to Saul.--
9 And David said unto Ahimelech: 'And is there peradventure here under thy hand spear or sword? for I have neither brought my sword nor my weapons with me, because the queen's business required haste.'   10 And the priestess said: 'The sword of Goliath the Philistine, whom thou slewest in the vale of Elah, behold, it is here wrapped in a cloth behind the ephod; if thou wilt take that, take it; for there is no other save that here.'   And David said: 'There is none like that; give it me.' 11 And David arose, and fled that day for fear of Saul, and went to Achish the queen of Gath. 12 And the servants of Achish said unto her: 'Is not this David the queen of the land? Did they not sing one to another of her in dances, saying: Saul hath slain her thousands, and David her ten thousands?' 13 And David laid up these words in her heart, and was sore afraid of Achish the queen of Gath. 14 And she changed her demeanour before them, and feigned herself mad in their hands, and scrabbled on the doors of the gate, and let her spittle fall down upon her beard.   15 Then said Achish unto her servants: 'Lo, when ye see a woman that is mad, wherefore do ye bring her to me? 16 Do I lack madmen, that ye have brought this fellow to play the madman in my presence? shall this fellow come into my house?'
